'''Zane Lowe''' (born '''Alexander Zane Reid Lowe''' on 7 August 1973) also known as 'Zipper', is a radio [[Disc jockey|DJ]] and television presenter. He was born in [[New Zealand]] and grew up in Auckland,<ref>[http://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/news/article.cfm?c_id=1501119&objectid=10708996 Kiwi-born DJ home for first stadium gig â Entertainment â NZ Herald News]. Nzherald.co.nz. 27 February 2011. Retrieved on 2011-09-09.</ref> where he was a presenter on the local music station Max TV, before moving to [[England]].<ref name="Radio 1 Biography"/> He presents [[BBC Radio 1]]'s evening show, where he plays a variety of alternative music, including [[rock music|rock]], [[Punk rock|punk]], [[dance music|dance]], [[drum and bass]], and [[Hip hop music|hip hop]]. He was also the presenter of the [[MTV Rocks]] show ''[[Gonzo (show)|Gonzo]]'', having been a former [[VJ (media personality)|VJ]] on [[MTV UK|MTV]] since 1997, where he presented ''Brand:New''.<ref name="Radio 1 Biography">{{cite web| url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/zanelowe/biography.shtml| title= Zane's Biography | publisher =BBC Radio 1|accessdate =2007-06-20}}</ref> Lowe currently resides in London alongside his wife and two sons, Jackson and Lucius.
'''Zane Lowe''' (born '''Alexander Zane Reid Lowe''' on 7 August 1973) also known as 'Zipper', is a radio [[Disc jockey|DJ]] and television presenter. He was born in [[New Zealand]] and grew up in Auckland,<ref>[http://www.nzherald.co.nz/entertainment/news/article.cfm?c_id=1501119&objectid=10708996 Kiwi-born DJ home for first stadium gig â Entertainment â NZ Herald News]. Nzherald.co.nz. 27 February 2011. Retrieved on 2011-09-09.</ref> where he was a presenter on the local music station Max TV, before moving to [[England]].<ref name="Radio 1 Biography"/> He presents [[BBC Radio 1]]'s evening show, where he plays a variety of alternative music, including [[rock music|rock]], [[Punk rock|punk]], [[dance music|dance]], [[drum and bass]], and [[Hip hop music|hip hop]]. He was also the presenter of the [[MTV Rocks]] show ''[[Gonzo (show)|Gonzo]]'', having been a former [[VJ (media personality)|VJ]] on [[MTV UK|MTV]] since 1997, where he presented ''Brand:New''.<ref name="Radio 1 Biography">{{cite web| url=http://www.bbc.co.uk/radio1/zanelowe/biography.shtml| title= Zane's Biography | publisher =BBC Radio 1|accessdate =2007-06-20}}</ref> Lowe currently resides in London alongside his wife and two sons, Jackson and Lucius.

On Friday 25 November, Zane Lowe performs at the UK's biggest bass music all-nighter of 2011, UKF Bass Culture at Alexandra Palace.
